channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The planet is getting hotter fast. This is what happens to your body in extreme heat
item.description: Human-caused climate change has already made heat waves around the world more frequent and intense.

item.title: Doctors treat thousands of heatstroke victims in southern Pakistan as temperatures soar
item.description: Officials say a days-long intense heat wave has disrupted normal life in Pakistan, especially in the southern city of Karachi, where doctors have treated thousands of victims of heatstroke

item.title: ‘We’re heartbroken’: Raging blaze tears through historic restaurant under construction in Boston
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Temperatures soar in North Texas, head advisory in effect
item.description: The brutal hot weather that's seemingly been ping-ponging across the U.S. this month has North Texas in its sights, with temperatures there on Tuesday expected to feel as high as 109 degrees. Bo Evans from CBS News Texas has more.

item.title: The Juneteenth flag is full of symbols. Here's what they mean
item.description: Designing the Juneteenth flag was a deliberate process, says creator Ben Haith, who breaks down what each element of the flag represents.

item.title: Multiple deaths reported as police clash with anti-tax protesters in Kenya
item.description: Police allegedly fired live ammunition at anti-government protesters in Nairobi on Tuesday as thousands of people demonstrated against proposed tax hikes.

item.title: UN tells Israel it will suspend aid operations across Gaza without improved safety, UN officials say
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: More arguments expected in Trump classified docs case after tense hearing
item.description: Tuesday will see more hearings in Donald Trump's classified documents case after a Monday hearing that saw a tense exchange between Judge Aileen Cannon and a prosecutor in the case. Attorney and CBS News campaign reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.

item.title: June 18 2024: US heat wave news
item.description: A dangerous heat wave is scorching parts of the Midwest and Northeast. Record-breaking high temperatures are forecast across dozens of cities where cooling centers have been opened to protect the vulnerable.

item.title: Consumer confidence in U.S. falls in June as Americans fret about near-term prospects
item.description: American consumers lost some confidence in June as expectations over the near-term future fell again

item.title: Decades Of Data Reveal A Steady Decline In America's Middle Class, According To Latest Research
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Taylor Swift appears to respond to Dave Grohl's Eras Tour remarks
item.description: Even though is Foo Fighters bandmate attended Swift's concert, Dave Grohl became seen as anti-Swift and was trending on social media this week.

item.title: 'I know it happens': Boeing chief admits the company has retaliated against whistleblowers
item.description: The outgoing chief of the embattled airplane maker is testifying in the wake of a whistleblower's allegations of safety issues.

item.title: Man guns down 3 women, including his mom, in separate shootings within 1 hour
item.description: A man is dead after allegedly gunning down his mother, his cousin and an ex-girlfriend's new partner in three separate shootings in Florida Monday night.

item.title: "It Feels Weird Now": Frustrated People Are Recalling The Once-Normal Things The Pandemic Completely Ruined
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: "World is not watching" as famine risk looms in Sudan, agency says
item.description: An aid agency issued a "crisis alert" over war-torn Sudan, calling out the international community for its failure to address the civil war.

item.title: June 17, 2024 - Israel-Gaza news
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has disbanded the country's war cabinet, an Israeli official says, just over a week after opposition leader Benny Gantz withdrew from the body.

item.title: Sealed notes shed light on Trump's alleged efforts to hide classified documents
item.description: Donald Trump expressed concern that turning over classified documents after a May 2022 subpoena could result in criminal charges, according to notes reviewed by ABC News.

item.title: 73-year-old Tallahassee man was struck by lightning, killed during March walk in park
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: What is AARP?
item.description: AARP is a non-profit organization that can save you money. Learn about AARP memberships, savings and more here.
